title: 2010–11 Liga Premier de Ascenso season
text:
The 2010–11 Liga Premier de Ascenso season was split in two tournaments <a href="%23Torneo%20Independencia">Independencia</a> and <a href="%23Torneo%20Revoluci%C3%B3n">Revolución</a>. <a href="Liga%20Premier%20de%20Ascenso">Liga Premier</a> was the third-tier <a href="Association%20football">football</a> league of <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. The season was played between 27 August 2010 and 21 May 2011. 
Torneo Independencia.
Liguilla.
The fifth or sixth best teams of each group play two games against each other on a home-and-away basis. The higher seeded teams play on their home field during the second leg. The winner of each match up is determined by <a href="Two-legged%20tie%23Tiebreaking">aggregate score</a>. In the Round of 8, quarterfinals and semifinals, if the two teams are tied on aggregate the higher seeded team advances. In the final, if the two teams are tied after both legs, the match goes to extra time and, if necessary, a <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a>.
Torneo Revolución.
Liguilla.
The fifth or sixth best teams of each group play two games against each other on a home-and-away basis. The higher seeded teams play on their home field during the second leg. The winner of each match up is determined by <a href="Two-legged%20tie%23Tiebreaking">aggregate score</a>. In the Round of 8, quarterfinals and semifinals, if the two teams are tied on aggregate the higher seeded team advances. In the final, if the two teams are tied after both legs, the match goes to extra time and, if necessary, a <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a>.
Promotion Final.
The Promotion Final is a series of matches played by the champions of the tournaments Apertura and Clausura, the game is played to determine the winning team of the promotion to Liga de Ascenso. 
The first leg was played on 14 May 2011, and the second leg was played on 21 May 2011.
